result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G. Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

miscConds.notes: Court costs due during probation term. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08. Defendant authorized to drive out of state up to 12 hours per day.

-Court orders forfeiture of weapon.
-Court further orders defendant may not possess any firearms during probation term.

-No contact with victim.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Court authorizes defendant permission to drive out of state up to 12 hours per day.
-Pay supervision fees.
